App description:
The Wizards support Oculus Store Cross-Buy!

The Wizards is an award-winning action-adventure game with an unique system of casting spells with hand gestures and acclaimed narration and voice acting by Jason Marnocha.

Use Touch controllers to destroy your enemies by weaving magic into lightning, fireballs, and other elemental spells. Chain combos and use different tactics against the hostile creatures. Make the game as challenging or as casual as you like with Fate Cards, and become the hero youve always wanted to be with powerful spells at your fingertips!

 Action-adventure VR spellcaster set in a rich fantasy world
 Campaign featuring time travel, heroic battles and dragons
 Intuitive system of casting spells with hand gestures
 Element-based spells to learn and upgrade
 High replayability thanks to game-modifying Fate Cards
 Free movement and/or free teleportation-based exploration
 Left-handed mode

Blew my expectations out of the water

I had heard people talk about how the gameplay gets repetitive and it just basically is killing wave after wave of enemy's but I was very happily surprised that it isn't, the levels are large and not always a single linear path to follow due to hidden objects around such as fate cards and fairy fragments. The graphics are not incredible but it is a quest game and you have to keep in mind its limitations, it looks great for what they were working with. The spell mechanics are fun and make you feel like a real wizard when you are surrounded by a ton of enemies and chaining together spell after spell at enemy's, I like being able to upgrade spells to make them more powerful because it gave me the sense of progression as I continued through the campaign, like I was slowly getting more familiar with the art of wizardry. Perfect VR concept

First and foremost, this is something at its core that is best suited for VR over any other format. The spellcasting concept is great and well executed. The graphics are passable, but I found the sense of scale excellent and did feel fully immersed. The story is minimal, but the voice work is excellent. I especially loved how the sanctum works as a very creative menu- really wish more games would incorporate things like this. I enjoyed it enough to complete all levels and spells to max. I may continue further as the leaderboard proves a good enticement (maybe after new tracking updates.)

I did have a few notes:
Sound, while sufficient, seems an easy fix to really make things more epic. Spells just never feel that powerful. Also, there's a weird delay- if you drop an object, the sound comes a second or so after impact. Most frustrating was footsteps (which can be lowered in options). What is supposed to be the sound of your footsteps always sounded a few paces back and slightly to the left of me. I never got used to it and often found myself spinning around looking for an attacker.

Color- the pallate is very bland. I think some creative lighting and splashes of color would go a long way.

All or nothing attacks: The game is broken up into areas of exploration and battle arenas. I would have enjoyed some smaller attacks and more one-on-one encounters.

At current pricing I feel I got enough value, but if it was maybe $5 less it would be a full recommend. That said, I would absolutely purchase a sequel.

The overall theme, atmosphere and voice acting were excellent. However, the plot, and most importantly, the controls were a bit of a chore to figure out. The real show stopper for me, however, were the controls. When casting spells I often felt that the gesture detection was off and certain spells required far more effort to chuck at am enemy than any real life ball would have. The auto aim system was unhelpful in remedying this, as I would hurl a fireball with a full swing only to have it drop to the ground one foot in front of me; very unsatisfactory. While I could see someone being entertained with this game for nine or ten hours, I have no desire to replay any missions, so I won't be logging any more than the three or four hours that it took me to beat the main story. About me: I am quickly becoming a VR vetran with over 60 hours of play logged on my Quest since purchase. I have always loved Wizards, and I want to be one when I get old. Based on my level of experience and my baises, I would not recommend this game to a friend.
